alert.note: Alert for Surry; Wilkes; Yadkin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 8:53PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .Several rounds of thunderstorms with very heavy rain will produce minor flooding tonight. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina and northwest North Carolina, including the following counties, in north central North Carolina, Surry. In northwest North Carolina, Wilkes and Yadkin. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 851 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cooks Creek, Ararat River, Cranberry Creek, Arnold Branch, Camp Creek, Christian Creek, Cody Creek, Cobb Creek, Beaverdam Creek, Bull Creek, Big Bugaboo Creek and Beaver Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elkin... Fairview... Yadkinville... Jonesville... Dobson... Boonville... East Bend... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
